intro: Peucedanum podolicum, commonly known as the Podolic cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped flowers. It is a perennial herb native to Central and Eastern Europe, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, parsley-like scent when crushed. Peucedanum podolicum is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
